title: Voting guide: Here’s what voters need to know before Boston’s Tuesday election
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Boston polls open 7 a.m. to 8 p.m. across 275 precincts for City Council and unopposed mayoral race.
Mailed ballots must be returned to 22 drop boxes or City Hall by 8 p.m. Tuesday; polling drop-off not allowed.
City Council at-large race features eight candidates for four seats; contested district races vary in competition.

title: The Bruins’ second line is looking like a difference-maker, in more ways than one
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Casey Mittelstadt's return bolsters Bruins' second line, which outscored opponents 4-2 in recent games.
Coach Marco Sturm emphasized mindset to benched players, leading to performances like Marat Khusnutdinov's overtime win.
Trade deadline options may arise if second line continues to excel; Mitchell could draw interest as high-value asset.

title: Garrett Crochet, Roman Anthony named finalist for Cy Young, Rookie of the Year Awards
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Garrett Crochet of the Red Sox named as a finalist for the AL Cy Young Award alongside Tarik Skubal and Hunter Brown.
Crochet led the AL in innings pitched (205.1) and strikeouts (255) during his first season with an 18-5 record.
Roman Anthony from the Red Sox is a finalist for AL Rookie of the Year, competing against Nick Kurtz and Jacob Wilson.

title: Ranking top priorities for Patriots at NFL trade deadline
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots targeting edge rusher as top priority before NFL trade deadline, considering options like Tennessee's Arden Key.
Running back depth a concern with injuries to Antonio Gibson and Rhamondre Stevenson; Jerome Ford mentioned as potential acquisition.
Linebacker position remains thin; potential target is hybrid player Jamal Adams to boost coverage capabilities.

title: Patriots’ pass-protection issues are mounting as Drake Maye ties worrisome stat from last year
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: The New England Patriots have allowed 34 sacks this season, second-most in the NFL, with 12 in the last two games.
Quarterback Drake Maye has already matched his sack total from last season, despite playing four fewer games.
Patriots' offensive line struggles include Garrett Bradbury acknowledging the need for improvement in pass protection for Maye.

title: Downtown Boston hotel settles discrimination complaint after woman was accused of being a man
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Liberty Hotel in Boston settled a discrimination complaint after a woman was wrongly accused of being a man.
The hotel agreed to update nondiscrimination policies and make a $10,000 charitable donation to an LGBTQIA2S+ nonprofit.
The couple involved plans to file a civil lawsuit for punitive damages against the hotel for the incident.

title: Falcons coach walks back ‘clapgate’ accusations after Patriots push back
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Falcons coach Raheem Morris retracted accusations against the Patriots of simulating Atlanta's snap count after their 24-23 loss.
Morris initially claimed the Patriots mimicked QB Michael Penix Jr.'s clapping, causing an intentional grounding penalty.
Patriots coach Mike Vrabel dismissed the 'clapgate' claims, noting no evidence of such actions during the game.

title: Alex Bregman opts out of Red Sox contract, will hit free agency
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Alex Bregman opts out of Red Sox contract, entering free agency with two years and $80 million remaining.
Bregman posted a .273/.360/.462 slash line with 18 HRs, 62 RBIs in 114 games during the 2025 season.
The Red Sox may attempt to re-sign Bregman, but competition includes teams like the Tigers and Mariners.

title: Patriots NFL trade deadline live updates: Will New England make moves before Tuesday?
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The NFL trade deadline is set for 4 p.m. Tuesday, and the Patriots are considering roster moves.
Patriots may seek to upgrade positions but must balance costs for future sustainability.
The team has shown interest in acquiring players like Trey Hendrickson and Jaylen Waddle.

title: After an eventful week, Bruins’ Hampus Lindholm has ‘a lot to be thankful for’
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Hampus Lindholm and fiancée Amanda welcomed their first child, Magnolia, named after Amanda's favorite tree.
Lindholm returned to Bruins' lineup after a lower-body injury, with the team going 5-1-0 since his return.
Coach Marco Sturm noted Lindholm's on-ice presence and leadership as key to improving the Bruins' defense.
